intro: Hieracium prominentistylum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, making it visually striking. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Hieracium prominentistylum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, contributing to its widespread distribution.
